required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacokinetics of Acetaminophen in Pediatric Patients With Congenital Heart Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Pharmacokinetics of Acetaminophen in Pediatric Patients With Congenital Heart Disease

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective study of pediatric patients with congenital heart disease, in which acetaminophen serum concentrations will be measured following a single intraoperative intravenous dose of acetaminophen. These levels will be used to develop a pharmacokinetic model. Serum concentrations will be compared between two groups of patients: (1) cyanotic patients presenting for the Fontan completion operation and (2) patients with acyanotic congenital heart disease presenting for repair via median sternotomy.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 15-20 minutes; 30-40 minutes; 50-70 minutes; 80-100 minutes; 2 Hours, 4 Hours; and 6-Hours Post-IV acetaminophen administration
primary_outcome.description: To determine the change in serum concentration of acetaminophen between each timepoint.

arm_group.description: Cyanotic congenital heart disease (CHD) patients presenting for Fontan palliation.
Acyanotic congenital heart disease (CHD) patients presenting for repair via median sternotomy.

intervention.description: IV acetaminophen given as part of standard of care.

study_pop.textblock: Pediatric congenital heard disease patients undergoing cardiac surgery and receiving IV acetaminophen during their surgical procedure as standard of care.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients presenting for Fontan palliation or for surgical repair requiring median sternotomy, will be included in the study.
- Only patients who receive intravenous acetaminophen in the operating room will have serum levels drawn.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Documentation of an allergy to acetaminophen
- Severe hepatic disease or other contraindications to acetaminophen use
- Patient has received acetaminophen within 24 hours of their procedure
